name: ViaPost
tag_list: post, voip, mail, save-money, cost, cost-saving, dm, direct-mail
overview:
Viapost Ltd. (company no. 06059866) went into administration on the 12th October 2009. It has since been taken over, and a new company formed. The new as company maintains the Viapost name in the form of “Viapost Communications Ltd.” (company no. 07037166).

ViaPost is the Skype of post (Post Over Internet Protocol)â€¦send physical letters direct from your computer at the touch of a button from 35p + VAT, including print, stationary, envelope and 2 day delivery. No more stuffing envelopes or licking stamps.

ViaPost is a simpler, more secure, greener and cost efficient alternative to traditional mail that integrates simply with existing business practice and infrastructure. The free software can be installed on any Windows XP or Vista computer, with a Mac version coming shortly, and enables the sending of physical post by simply clicking â€œprintâ€.

The unique ViaPost regional print system offers businesses and individuals the opportunity to powerfully communicate with any individual in the UK by sending physical mail directly from any computer.

There is no minimum or maximum volume of letters that can be sent ViaPost and all post is printed at secure, high-end digital printers located strategically around the country. This network is formed of experienced and trusted print companies and by printing post at the print centre closest to the destination address, ViaPost can reduce the carbon footprint of each letter by 81%.

The price of sending a letter ViaPost starts at just 35p + VAT including all printing and delivery, and ViaPost will maintain the exact format, layout and colour of all letters and all post is printed anonymously. We value your privacy and security as much as you do. This price can be significantly less for high volume customers such as utilities companies, financial services companies etc.

external_links.title: Viapost Communications Ltd. is a Phoenix company born from the demise of Viapost Ltd.
